---
project: @pautena/react-design-system
version: 0.21.0
generated: 2026-02-11T23:20:31.379Z
storybook: ^10.1.11
base_url: https://pautena.com/react-design-system
source_index: index.json
---

# @pautena/react-design-system Storybook

> Machine-readable index of Storybook docs and stories.

Generated from Storybook static build data to help LLMs navigate story and docs pages.

## Usage
- Use ?path=/docs/... for docs pages
- Use ?path=/story/... for interactive stories

## Index
- [index.json](./index.json)

## Docs

It can be a single string or an array of strings. / content: string | string[]; /** Optional spacing value for the board. It can be one of the values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5. / spacing?: 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5; /** Optional styling properties for the board, using the theme's styling system. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; }>; /** Board component that displays content within a styled Paper component. It supports rendering an array of content lines or a single content string. Additionally, it provides a button to copy the content to the clipboard.

#### Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Docs
- Text to display on the confirm button. / confirmText?: string; /** Text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Optional passphrase for additional confirmation. / passphrase?: string; /** Callback function to handle cancel action. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to handle confirm action. / onConfirm: () => void; } /** ConfirmDialog component renders a dialog to ask a user to confirm an action with customizable title, confirmation and cancellation actions. It optionally requires a passphrase to enable the confirmation action.

Put your form inside and receive the data validated using the input name field.

#### Components/Inputs/Action - Docs
- The variant of the action. / variant: ActionVariant; /** The title of the action. / title: string; /** The variant of the title. / titleVariant?: Extract<TypographyProps["variant"], "h4" | "h5" | "h6">; /** The description of the action. / description?: string | ReactElement; /** The variant of the description. / descriptionVariant?: TypographyProps["variant"]; /** The helper text for the action. / helperText?: string; /** The variant of the helper text. / helperTextVariant?: TypographyProps["variant"]; /** The text for the action button. / buttonText: string; /** Indicates if the action requires confirmation. / confirmable?: boolean; /** The title for the confirmation dialog. / confirmTitle?: string; /** The description for the confirmation dialog. / confirmDescription?: string; /** The passphrase required to perform action. / passphrase?: string; /** The callback function to be executed when the action is triggered. / onAction: () => void; } /** Renders an action button with a text that explains what it does.

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Docs
- Props for the Autocomplete component. / export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { /** The label for the autocomplete input. / label: string; /** Optional helper text to display below the input. / helperText?: string; /** Optional color for the autocomplete component. / color?: string; /** If `true`, indicates that data is being fetched. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional callback function that is called when the value changes. / onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { label: string; helperText?: string; color?: string; fetching?: boolean; onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } /** Autocomplete component that wraps the MUI Autocomplete component with additional props.
- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Inputs/DateRangeCalendar - Docs
- Props for the DateRangeCalendar component. / export interface DateRangeCalendarProps { /** The default date range value. / defaultValue: DateRange; /** Callback function that is called when the date range value changes. / onValueChange: (value: DateRange, updatedIndex: number) => void; } /** A Date Range Calendar component that allows users to select a range of dates.

#### Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Docs
- Props for the DateRangePicker component. / export interface DateRangePickerProps { /** The label for the date range picker. / label: string; /** The default value for the date range picker. / defaultValue: DateRange; /** The format in which the date range should be displayed. / format: string; /** If true, the date range picker will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The size of the date range picker. / size?: "small" | "medium"; /** Callback function that is called when the value of the date range picker changes. / onValueChange: (value: DateRange, index: number) => void; } /** DateRangePicker component allows users to select a date range.
- [Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-daterangepicker--docs) {id:components-inputs-daterangepicker--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Docs
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.
- [Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-searchinput--docs) {id:components-inputs-searchinput--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Docs
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. This component supports additional features such as loading and fetching states, custom colors, and full-width display.
- [Components/Inputs/Select - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-select--docs) {id:components-inputs-select--docs} [docs]

Can be a number (interpreted as pixels) or a string (e.g., "100%", "50px"). / width?: number | string; /** The animation style for the skeleton card. Can be "pulse", "wave", or false to disable animation. / animation?: "pulse" | "wave" | false; } /** SkeletonCard component renders a skeleton loading placeholder for a card.

#### Components/Tables/EnhancedRemoteTable - Docs
- The array of data to be displayed in the table. / data: T[]; /** Indicates whether the table is in a loading state. / loading: boolean; /** The default column to sort by. / defaultSort: keyof T; /** The default order of sorting (ascending or descending). / defaultOrder?: Order; /** The columns configuration for the table. / columns: HeadCell<T>[]; /** A render function for each row of data. / children: (data: T, index: number) => ReactNode; /** Callback function to handle sorting requests. / onRequestSort: (col: keyof T, orderBy: "asc" | "desc") => void; } export interface EnhancedRemoteTableProps<T> { data: T[]; loading: boolean; defaultSort: keyof T; defaultOrder?: Order; columns: HeadCell<T>[]; children: (data: T, index: number) => ReactNode; onRequestSort: (col: keyof T, orderBy: "asc" | "desc") => void; } /** EnhancedRemoteTable component provides a table with remote data handling capabilities. It supports sorting and displays a loading indicator while data is being fetched.
- [Components/Tables/EnhancedRemoteTable - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-enhancedremotetable--docs) {id:components-tables-enhancedremotetable--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Tables/EnhancedTable - Docs
- Props for the EnhancedTable component. / interface EnhancedTableProps<T> { /** The array of data to be displayed in the table. / readonly data: T[]; /** Optional. If true, enables the search functionality. / search?: boolean; /** The key of the data to sort by default. / defaultSort: keyof T; /** Optional. The default order of sorting (ascending or descending). / defaultOrder?: Order; /** Optional. If true, displays a loading indicator. / loading?: boolean; /** The columns configuration for the table. / columns: HeadCell<T>[]; /** A render prop function that takes the sorted and filtered data and returns a ReactNode. / children: (data: T[]) => ReactNode; } /** EnhancedTable component provides a table with sorting, filtering, and loading states.
- [Components/Tables/EnhancedTable - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-enhancedtable--docs) {id:components-tables-enhancedtable--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Docs
- Props for the RemoteDataTable component / export type RemoteDataTableProps<TData> = { /** Array of data items to display in the table */ data: TData[]; /** Column definitions for the table */ columns: RemoteDataTableColumn<TData>[]; /** Optional function to generate unique row IDs. If not provided, uses array index */ getRowId?: (row: TData, index: number) => string; /** Current pagination state (pageIndex and pageSize) */ pagination: PaginationState; /** Callback fired when pagination changes */ onPaginationChange: OnChangeFn<PaginationState>; /** Current sorting state */ sorting?: SortingState; /** Callback fired when sorting changes */ onSortingChange?: OnChangeFn<SortingState>; /** Total number of rows available (for server-side pagination). If not provided, uses data.length */ rowCount?: number; /** Whether data is currently loading */ loading?: boolean; /** Message to display when there is no data / emptyMessage?: string; /** Available page size options for the pagination dropdown / pageSizeOptions?: number[]; /** Callback fired when a row is clicked */ onRowClick?: (row: TData) => void; /** Configuration for the query builder (filters) */ query?: RemoteDataTableQueryBuilderProps; }; const defaultPageSizeOptions = [10, 25, 50]; /** A table component designed for displaying remote/server-side data with built-in pagination, sorting, and filtering capabilities. This component is fully controlled - all state (pagination, sorting, filters) must be managed by the parent component. For convenience, use the `useRemoteDataTable` hook to manage this state. ```tsx const tableState = useRemoteDataTable({ initialPagination: { pageSize: 25 } }); <RemoteDataTable data={items} columns={columns} {...tableState} query={{ fields: queryFields, filters: tableState.filters, onFiltersChange: tableState.onFiltersChange }} /> ```
- [Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-remotedatatable--docs) {id:components-tables-remotedatatable--docs} [docs]

### Generators

#### Generators/Generators - Docs
- [Generators/Generators - Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-generators--docs) {id:generators-generators--docs} [docs]

#### Generators/ModelForm - Docs
- ModelForm component is a generic form component for handling model-based forms. It renders form fields based on the provided model and handles form submission.
- [Generators/ModelForm - Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-modelform--docs) {id:generators-modelform--docs} [docs]

#### Generators/ObjectDetails - Docs
- ObjectDetails component renders detailed information about a given instance of a model. It supports rendering various types of fields including single values, groups, and arrays of groups.
- [Generators/ObjectDetails - Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-objectdetails--docs) {id:generators-objectdetails--docs} [docs]

#### Generators/TableList - Docs
- TableList component renders a list about a given instances of a model.
- [Generators/TableList - Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-tablelist--docs) {id:generators-tablelist--docs} [docs]

#### Layouts/HeaderLayout - Docs
- Interface representing the slots for the HeaderLayout component. / export interface HeaderLayoutSlots { /** Optional slot for the header component. Should be a JSX element constructor that takes HeaderProps as props. / header?: JSXElementConstructor<HeaderProps>; /** Optional slot for the content component. Should be a JSX element constructor that takes ContentProps as props. / content?: JSXElementConstructor<ContentProps>; } /** Props for the HeaderLayout component slots. / export interface HeaderLayoutSlotProps { /** Props for the header slot. / header?: HeaderProps; /** Props for the content slot. / content?: ContentProps; } /** Represents an error that can occur in the HeaderLayout component. / export interface HeaderLayoutError { /** Optional icon to display with the error. / icon?: PlaceholderIcon; /** Optional title for the error. / title?: string; /** The error message to display. / message: string; } export type HeaderLayoutProps = PropsWithChildren<{ /** The title to be displayed in the header. / title: string | ReactElement; /** An optional subtitle to be displayed in the header. / subtitle?: string | ReactElement; /** Optional slots for custom components within the header layout. / slots?: HeaderLayoutSlots; /** Optional props for the custom slots. / slotProps?: HeaderLayoutSlotProps; /** Optional flag to indicate if the header layout is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional flag to indicate if the header layout is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional error object to be displayed in the header layout. / error?: HeaderLayoutError; }>; const DefaultErrorIcon = () => ( <ReportProblemIcon color="error" sx={{ width: 200, height: 200 }} /> ); /** A layout component that provides a header and content area with optional loading, fetching, and error states.
- [Layouts/HeaderLayout - Docs](./?path=/docs/layouts-headerlayout--docs) {id:layouts-headerlayout--docs} [docs]

#### Layouts/Layouts - Docs
- [Layouts/Layouts - Docs](./?path=/docs/layouts-layouts--docs) {id:layouts-layouts--docs} [docs]

### Usage - Docs

#### Usage - Docs
- [Usage - Docs](./?path=/docs/usage--docs) {id:usage--docs} [docs]

#### Components/Data Display/Board - Array List
- Props for the Board component. / export type BoardProps = PropsWithChildren<{ /** The content to be displayed on the board. It can be a single string or an array of strings. / content: string | string[]; /** Optional spacing value for the board. It can be one of the values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5. / spacing?: 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5; /** Optional styling properties for the board, using the theme's styling system. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; }>; /** Board component that displays content within a styled Paper component. It supports rendering an array of content lines or a single content string. Additionally, it provides a button to copy the content to the clipboard.

It supports customization for dense layout and centered content.

Overrides variant / color?: string; /** Custom styles / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** Show the text as uppercase / textTransform?: "none" | "capitalize" | "uppercase"; } /** Compact element to represent a text
- [Components/Data Display/Label - Info](./?path=/story/components-data-display-label--info) {id:components-data-display-label--info} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-data-display-label--docs)

#### Components/Data Display/Label - Light Color
- Content of the component / text: string; /** Color palette used to draw the component / variant?: LabelVariant; /** Background color. Overrides variant / color?: string; /** Custom styles / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** Show the text as uppercase / textTransform?: "none" | "capitalize" | "uppercase"; } /** Compact element to represent a text
- [Components/Data Display/Label - Light Color](./?path=/story/components-data-display-label--light-color) {id:components-data-display-label--light-color} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-data-display-label--docs)

#### Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Custom Button Text
- Text to display on the confirm button. / confirmText?: string; /** Text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Optional passphrase for additional confirmation. / passphrase?: string; /** Callback function to handle cancel action. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to handle confirm action. / onConfirm: () => void; } /** ConfirmDialog component renders a dialog to ask a user to confirm an action with customizable title, confirmation and cancellation actions. It optionally requires a passphrase to enable the confirmation action.
- [Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Custom Button Text](./?path=/story/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--custom-button-text) {id:components-dialogs-confirmdialog--custom-button-text} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--docs)

- Text to display on the confirm button. / confirmText?: string; /** Text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Optional passphrase for additional confirmation. / passphrase?: string; /** Callback function to handle cancel action. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to handle confirm action. / onConfirm: () => void; } /** ConfirmDialog component renders a dialog to ask a user to confirm an action with customizable title, confirmation and cancellation actions. It optionally requires a passphrase to enable the confirmation action.
- [Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Default](./?path=/story/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--default) {id:components-dialogs-confirmdialog--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--docs)

- Text to display on the confirm button. / confirmText?: string; /** Text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Optional passphrase for additional confirmation. / passphrase?: string; /** Callback function to handle cancel action. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to handle confirm action. / onConfirm: () => void; } /** ConfirmDialog component renders a dialog to ask a user to confirm an action with customizable title, confirmation and cancellation actions. - [Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Loading](./?path=/story/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--loading) {id:components-dialogs-confirmdialog--loading} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--docs)

#### Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Passphrase
- Text to display on the confirm button. / confirmText?: string; /** Text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Optional passphrase for additional confirmation. / passphrase?: string; /** Callback function to handle cancel action. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to handle confirm action. / onConfirm: () => void; } /** ConfirmDialog component renders a dialog to ask a user to confirm an action with customizable title, confirmation and cancellation actions. It optionally requires a passphrase to enable the confirmation action.
- [Components/Dialogs/ConfirmDialog - Passphrase](./?path=/story/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--passphrase) {id:components-dialogs-confirmdialog--passphrase} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-dialogs-confirmdialog--docs)

#### Components/Dialogs/FormDialog - Custom Button Text
- Props for the FormDialog component. / export interface FormDialogProps<T> extends Omit<BootstrapDialogDialogProps, OmitBaseDialogProps> { /** The text to display on the submit button. / submitText?: string; /** The text to display on the cancel button. / cancelText?: string; /** Callback function to be called when the cancel button is clicked. / onCancel: () => void; /** Callback function to be called when the submit button is clicked. / onSubmit: (data: T) => void; } /** A generic form dialog component that wraps a BootstrapDialog and handles form submission. Put your form inside and receive the data validated using the input name field.

- The error title / name?: string; /** The description of the error / message: string; } export interface QueryContainerSuccess { /** The success title / name?: string; /** The success text / message: string; } export type QueryContainerProps = PropsWithChildren<{ /** There is a query in progress and we have available data / fetching?: boolean | boolean[]; /** There is a query in progress and we don't have available data / loading?: boolean | boolean[]; /** The query has returned an error / error?: QueryContainerError; /** The query has finished successfully / success?: QueryContainerSuccess; }>; /** Component to show different indicators based on the usual api query statuses

#### Components/Inputs/Action - Confirmable
- The variant of the action. / variant: ActionVariant; /** The title of the action. / title: string; /** The variant of the title. / titleVariant?: Extract<TypographyProps["variant"], "h4" | "h5" | "h6">; /** The description of the action. / description?: string | ReactElement; /** The variant of the description. / descriptionVariant?: TypographyProps["variant"]; /** The helper text for the action. / helperText?: string; /** The variant of the helper text. / helperTextVariant?: TypographyProps["variant"]; /** The text for the action button. / buttonText: string; /** Indicates if the action requires confirmation. / confirmable?: boolean; /** The title for the confirmation dialog. / confirmTitle?: string; /** The description for the confirmation dialog. / confirmDescription?: string; /** The passphrase required to perform action. / passphrase?: string; /** The callback function to be executed when the action is triggered. / onAction: () => void; } /** Renders an action button with a text that explains what it does.

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Default
- Props for the Autocomplete component. / export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { /** The label for the autocomplete input. / label: string; /** Optional helper text to display below the input. / helperText?: string; /** Optional color for the autocomplete component. / color?: string; /** If `true`, indicates that data is being fetched. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional callback function that is called when the value changes. / onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { label: string; helperText?: string; color?: string; fetching?: boolean; onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } /** Autocomplete component that wraps the MUI Autocomplete component with additional props.
- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Default](./?path=/story/components-inputs-autocomplete--default) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Fetching

- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Size Small](./?path=/story/components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Size Small Fetching
- Props for the Autocomplete component. / export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { /** The label for the autocomplete input. / label: string; /** Optional helper text to display below the input. / helperText?: string; /** Optional color for the autocomplete component. / color?: string; /** If `true`, indicates that data is being fetched. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional callback function that is called when the value changes. / onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { label: string; helperText?: string; color?: string; fetching?: boolean; onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } /** Autocomplete component that wraps the MUI Autocomplete component with additional props.
- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Size Small Fetching](./?path=/story/components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small-fetching) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small-fetching} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Size Small Loading
- Props for the Autocomplete component. / export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { /** The label for the autocomplete input. / label: string; /** Optional helper text to display below the input. / helperText?: string; /** Optional color for the autocomplete component. / color?: string; /** If `true`, indicates that data is being fetched. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional callback function that is called when the value changes. / onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { label: string; helperText?: string; color?: string; fetching?: boolean; onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } /** Autocomplete component that wraps the MUI Autocomplete component with additional props.
- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - Size Small Loading](./?path=/story/components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small-loading) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--size-small-loading} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - With Background
- Props for the Autocomplete component. / export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { /** The label for the autocomplete input. / label: string; /** Optional helper text to display below the input. / helperText?: string; /** Optional color for the autocomplete component. / color?: string; /** If `true`, indicates that data is being fetched. / fetching?: boolean; /** Optional callback function that is called when the value changes. / onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } export interface AutocompleteProps< T, Multiple extends boolean | undefined, DisableClearable extends boolean | undefined, FreeSolo extends boolean | undefined, ChipComponent extends React.ElementType = ChipTypeMap["defaultComponent"], > extends Omit< MuiAutocompleteProps< T, Multiple, DisableClearable, FreeSolo, ChipComponent >, "renderInput" | "onChange" | "color" > { label: string; helperText?: string; color?: string; fetching?: boolean; onChangeValue?: (value: T) => void; } /** Autocomplete component that wraps the MUI Autocomplete component with additional props.
- [Components/Inputs/Autocomplete - With Background](./?path=/story/components-inputs-autocomplete--with-background) {id:components-inputs-autocomplete--with-background} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-autocomplete--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/DateRangeCalendar - Default
- Props for the DateRangeCalendar component. / export interface DateRangeCalendarProps { /** The default date range value. / defaultValue: DateRange; /** Callback function that is called when the date range value changes. / onValueChange: (value: DateRange, updatedIndex: number) => void; } /** A Date Range Calendar component that allows users to select a range of dates.
- [Components/Inputs/DateRangeCalendar - Default](./?path=/story/components-inputs-daterangecalendar--default) {id:components-inputs-daterangecalendar--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-daterangecalendar--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Default
- Props for the DateRangePicker component. / export interface DateRangePickerProps { /** The label for the date range picker. / label: string; /** The default value for the date range picker. / defaultValue: DateRange; /** The format in which the date range should be displayed. / format: string; /** If true, the date range picker will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The size of the date range picker. / size?: "small" | "medium"; /** Callback function that is called when the value of the date range picker changes. / onValueChange: (value: DateRange, index: number) => void; } /** DateRangePicker component allows users to select a date range.
- [Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Default](./?path=/story/components-inputs-daterangepicker--default) {id:components-inputs-daterangepicker--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-daterangepicker--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Small
- Props for the DateRangePicker component. / export interface DateRangePickerProps { /** The label for the date range picker. / label: string; /** The default value for the date range picker. / defaultValue: DateRange; /** The format in which the date range should be displayed. / format: string; /** If true, the date range picker will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The size of the date range picker. / size?: "small" | "medium"; /** Callback function that is called when the value of the date range picker changes. / onValueChange: (value: DateRange, index: number) => void; } /** DateRangePicker component allows users to select a date range.
- [Components/Inputs/DateRangePicker - Small](./?path=/story/components-inputs-daterangepicker--small) {id:components-inputs-daterangepicker--small} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-daterangepicker--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Default
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.
- [Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Default](./?path=/story/components-inputs-searchinput--default) {id:components-inputs-searchinput--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-searchinput--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Helper Text
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.
- [Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Helper Text](./?path=/story/components-inputs-searchinput--helper-text) {id:components-inputs-searchinput--helper-text} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-searchinput--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Label
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.
- [Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Label](./?path=/story/components-inputs-searchinput--label) {id:components-inputs-searchinput--label} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-searchinput--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Placeholder
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - Small

#### Components/Inputs/SearchInput - With Filters
- The label for the search input. / label?: string; /** The placeholder text for the search input. / placeholder?: string; /** If true, the search input will take up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** Helper text to display below the search input. / helperText?: string; /** The size of the search input. / size?: SearchInputSize; /** An array of filters to apply to the search. / filters?: SearchFilter[]; /** The system prop that allows defining system overrides and additional CSS styles. / sx?: SxProps<Theme>; /** The format to use for date inputs. / dateFormat?: string; /** Callback function to handle the search action. / onSearch: (data: T) => void; } export interface SearchInputProps<T> { label?: string; placeholder?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; helperText?: string; size?: SearchInputSize; filters?: SearchFilter[]; sx?: SxProps<Theme>; dateFormat?: string; onSearch: (data: T) => void; } const filtersSx = { position: "absolute", }; const createInitialData = <T,>(filters: SearchFilter[]) => { const data: Record<string, unknown> = { search: "", }; const fields: Record<string, boolean> = { search: false }; filters.forEach(({ id, type }) => { if (type === "text") { data[id] = ""; } else if (type === "number") { data[id] = 0; } else if (type === "boolean") { data[id] = false; } else { data[id] = Date.now(); } fields[id] = false; }); return { initialData: data as T, fields, }; }; /** A generic search input component that supports various types of filters.

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Default
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. This component supports additional features such as loading and fetching states, custom colors, and full-width display.
- [Components/Inputs/Select - Default](./?path=/story/components-inputs-select--default) {id:components-inputs-select--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-select--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Fetching
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. This component supports additional features such as loading and fetching states, custom colors, and full-width display.
- [Components/Inputs/Select - Fetching](./?path=/story/components-inputs-select--fetching) {id:components-inputs-select--fetching} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-select--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Loading
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. This component supports additional features such as loading and fetching states, custom colors, and full-width display.
- [Components/Inputs/Select - Loading](./?path=/story/components-inputs-select--loading) {id:components-inputs-select--loading} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-select--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Select Loaded
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. This component supports additional features such as loading and fetching states, custom colors, and full-width display.
- [Components/Inputs/Select - Select Loaded](./?path=/story/components-inputs-select--select-loaded) {id:components-inputs-select--select-loaded} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-select--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/Select - Without Full Width
- The label for the select input. / label: string; /** The selected value. / value: T; /** If true, the select input is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** If true, the select input is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** The size of the select input. / size?: SelectSize; /** The color of the select input. / color?: string; /** If true, the select input takes up the full width of its container. / fullWidth?: boolean; /** The child elements to be rendered within the select input. / children?: ReactNode; /** The callback function to handle changes to the select input. / onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } export interface SelectProps<T> { label: string; value: T; loading?: boolean; fetching?: boolean; size?: SelectSize; color?: string; fullWidth?: boolean; children?: ReactNode; onChange?: MuiSelectProps<T>["onChange"]; } const ProgressSize: Record<SelectSize, number> = { small: 15, medium: 20, }; /** A custom Select component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI Select component. #### Components/Inputs/TextField - Default
- Props for the TextField component. / export type TextFieldProps = MuiTextFieldProps & { /** Indicates if the field is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Indicates if the field is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional hex color code for the text field. / hexColor?: string; }; /** A customizable TextField component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI TextField component and supports various props for styling and functionality.

#### Components/Inputs/TextField - Disabled
- Props for the TextField component. / export type TextFieldProps = MuiTextFieldProps & { /** Indicates if the field is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Indicates if the field is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional hex color code for the text field. / hexColor?: string; }; /** A customizable TextField component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI TextField component and supports various props for styling and functionality.

#### Components/Inputs/TextField - Fetching
- Props for the TextField component. / export type TextFieldProps = MuiTextFieldProps & { /** Indicates if the field is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Indicates if the field is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional hex color code for the text field. / hexColor?: string; }; /** A customizable TextField component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI TextField component and supports various props for styling and functionality.

#### Components/Inputs/TextField - Fetching With End Adornment
- Props for the TextField component. / export type TextFieldProps = MuiTextFieldProps & { /** Indicates if the field is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Indicates if the field is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional hex color code for the text field. / hexColor?: string; }; /** A customizable TextField component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI TextField component and supports various props for styling and functionality.
- [Components/Inputs/TextField - Fetching With End Adornment](./?path=/story/components-inputs-textfield--fetching-with-end-adornment) {id:components-inputs-textfield--fetching-with-end-adornment} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-textfield--docs)

#### Components/Inputs/TextField - Helper Text
- Props for the TextField component. / export type TextFieldProps = MuiTextFieldProps & { /** Indicates if the field is in a fetching state. / fetching?: boolean; /** Indicates if the field is in a loading state. / loading?: boolean; /** Optional hex color code for the text field. / hexColor?: string; }; /** A customizable TextField component that extends the functionality of the Material-UI TextField component and supports various props for styling and functionality.
- [Components/Inputs/TextField - Helper Text](./?path=/story/components-inputs-textfield--helper-text) {id:components-inputs-textfield--helper-text} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-inputs-textfield--docs)

#### Components/Placeholders/SkeletonCard - Default
- Props for the SkeletonCard component. / export interface SkeletonCardProps { /** The width of the skeleton card. Can be a number (interpreted as pixels) or a string (e.g., "100%", "50px"). / width?: number | string; /** The animation style for the skeleton card. Can be "pulse", "wave", or false to disable animation. / animation?: "pulse" | "wave" | false; } /** SkeletonCard component renders a skeleton loading placeholder for a card.

#### Components/Tables/EnhancedRemoteTable - Default
- The array of data to be displayed in the table. / data: T[]; /** Indicates whether the table is in a loading state. / loading: boolean; /** The default column to sort by. / defaultSort: keyof T; /** The default order of sorting (ascending or descending). / defaultOrder?: Order; /** The columns configuration for the table. / columns: HeadCell<T>[]; /** A render function for each row of data. / children: (data: T, index: number) => ReactNode; /** Callback function to handle sorting requests. / onRequestSort: (col: keyof T, orderBy: "asc" | "desc") => void; } export interface EnhancedRemoteTableProps<T> { data: T[]; loading: boolean; defaultSort: keyof T; defaultOrder?: Order; columns: HeadCell<T>[]; children: (data: T, index: number) => ReactNode; onRequestSort: (col: keyof T, orderBy: "asc" | "desc") => void; } /** EnhancedRemoteTable component provides a table with remote data handling capabilities. It supports sorting and displays a loading indicator while data is being fetched.
- [Components/Tables/EnhancedRemoteTable - Default](./?path=/story/components-tables-enhancedremotetable--default) {id:components-tables-enhancedremotetable--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-enhancedremotetable--docs)

#### Components/Tables/EnhancedTable - Default
- Props for the EnhancedTable component. / interface EnhancedTableProps<T> { /** The array of data to be displayed in the table. / readonly data: T[]; /** Optional. If true, enables the search functionality. / search?: boolean; /** The key of the data to sort by default. / defaultSort: keyof T; /** Optional. The default order of sorting (ascending or descending). / defaultOrder?: Order; /** Optional. If true, displays a loading indicator. / loading?: boolean; /** The columns configuration for the table. / columns: HeadCell<T>[]; /** A render prop function that takes the sorted and filtered data and returns a ReactNode. / children: (data: T[]) => ReactNode; } /** EnhancedTable component provides a table with sorting, filtering, and loading states.
- [Components/Tables/EnhancedTable - Default](./?path=/story/components-tables-enhancedtable--default) {id:components-tables-enhancedtable--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-enhancedtable--docs)

#### Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Default
- Props for the RemoteDataTable component / export type RemoteDataTableProps<TData> = { /** Array of data items to display in the table */ data: TData[]; /** Column definitions for the table */ columns: RemoteDataTableColumn<TData>[]; /** Optional function to generate unique row IDs. If not provided, uses array index */ getRowId?: (row: TData, index: number) => string; /** Current pagination state (pageIndex and pageSize) */ pagination: PaginationState; /** Callback fired when pagination changes */ onPaginationChange: OnChangeFn<PaginationState>; /** Current sorting state */ sorting?: SortingState; /** Callback fired when sorting changes */ onSortingChange?: OnChangeFn<SortingState>; /** Total number of rows available (for server-side pagination). If not provided, uses data.length */ rowCount?: number; /** Whether data is currently loading */ loading?: boolean; /** Message to display when there is no data / emptyMessage?: string; /** Available page size options for the pagination dropdown / pageSizeOptions?: number[]; /** Callback fired when a row is clicked */ onRowClick?: (row: TData) => void; /** Configuration for the query builder (filters) */ query?: RemoteDataTableQueryBuilderProps; }; const defaultPageSizeOptions = [10, 25, 50]; /** A table component designed for displaying remote/server-side data with built-in pagination, sorting, and filtering capabilities. This component is fully controlled - all state (pagination, sorting, filters) must be managed by the parent component. For convenience, use the `useRemoteDataTable` hook to manage this state. ```tsx const tableState = useRemoteDataTable({ initialPagination: { pageSize: 25 } }); <RemoteDataTable data={items} columns={columns} {...tableState} query={{ fields: queryFields, filters: tableState.filters, onFiltersChange: tableState.onFiltersChange }} /> ```
- [Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Default](./?path=/story/components-tables-remotedatatable--default) {id:components-tables-remotedatatable--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-remotedatatable--docs)

#### Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Sorted By Created Date
- Props for the RemoteDataTable component / export type RemoteDataTableProps<TData> = { /** Array of data items to display in the table */ data: TData[]; /** Column definitions for the table */ columns: RemoteDataTableColumn<TData>[]; /** Optional function to generate unique row IDs. If not provided, uses array index */ getRowId?: (row: TData, index: number) => string; /** Current pagination state (pageIndex and pageSize) */ pagination: PaginationState; /** Callback fired when pagination changes */ onPaginationChange: OnChangeFn<PaginationState>; /** Current sorting state */ sorting?: SortingState; /** Callback fired when sorting changes */ onSortingChange?: OnChangeFn<SortingState>; /** Total number of rows available (for server-side pagination). If not provided, uses data.length */ rowCount?: number; /** Whether data is currently loading */ loading?: boolean; /** Message to display when there is no data / emptyMessage?: string; /** Available page size options for the pagination dropdown / pageSizeOptions?: number[]; /** Callback fired when a row is clicked */ onRowClick?: (row: TData) => void; /** Configuration for the query builder (filters) */ query?: RemoteDataTableQueryBuilderProps; }; const defaultPageSizeOptions = [10, 25, 50]; /** A table component designed for displaying remote/server-side data with built-in pagination, sorting, and filtering capabilities. This component is fully controlled - all state (pagination, sorting, filters) must be managed by the parent component. For convenience, use the `useRemoteDataTable` hook to manage this state. ```tsx const tableState = useRemoteDataTable({ initialPagination: { pageSize: 25 } }); <RemoteDataTable data={items} columns={columns} {...tableState} query={{ fields: queryFields, filters: tableState.filters, onFiltersChange: tableState.onFiltersChange }} /> ```
- [Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Sorted By Created Date](./?path=/story/components-tables-remotedatatable--sorted-by-created-date) {id:components-tables-remotedatatable--sorted-by-created-date} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-remotedatatable--docs)

#### Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Using Hook
- Props for the RemoteDataTable component / export type RemoteDataTableProps<TData> = { /** Array of data items to display in the table */ data: TData[]; /** Column definitions for the table */ columns: RemoteDataTableColumn<TData>[]; /** Optional function to generate unique row IDs. If not provided, uses array index */ getRowId?: (row: TData, index: number) => string; /** Current pagination state (pageIndex and pageSize) */ pagination: PaginationState; /** Callback fired when pagination changes */ onPaginationChange: OnChangeFn<PaginationState>; /** Current sorting state */ sorting?: SortingState; /** Callback fired when sorting changes */ onSortingChange?: OnChangeFn<SortingState>; /** Total number of rows available (for server-side pagination). If not provided, uses data.length */ rowCount?: number; /** Whether data is currently loading */ loading?: boolean; /** Message to display when there is no data / emptyMessage?: string; /** Available page size options for the pagination dropdown / pageSizeOptions?: number[]; /** Callback fired when a row is clicked */ onRowClick?: (row: TData) => void; /** Configuration for the query builder (filters) */ query?: RemoteDataTableQueryBuilderProps; }; const defaultPageSizeOptions = [10, 25, 50]; /** A table component designed for displaying remote/server-side data with built-in pagination, sorting, and filtering capabilities. This component is fully controlled - all state (pagination, sorting, filters) must be managed by the parent component. For convenience, use the `useRemoteDataTable` hook to manage this state. ```tsx const tableState = useRemoteDataTable({ initialPagination: { pageSize: 25 } }); <RemoteDataTable data={items} columns={columns} {...tableState} query={{ fields: queryFields, filters: tableState.filters, onFiltersChange: tableState.onFiltersChange }} /> ```
- [Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - Using Hook](./?path=/story/components-tables-remotedatatable--using-hook) {id:components-tables-remotedatatable--using-hook} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-remotedatatable--docs)

#### Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - With Query Builder
- Props for the RemoteDataTable component / export type RemoteDataTableProps<TData> = { /** Array of data items to display in the table */ data: TData[]; /** Column definitions for the table */ columns: RemoteDataTableColumn<TData>[]; /** Optional function to generate unique row IDs. If not provided, uses array index */ getRowId?: (row: TData, index: number) => string; /** Current pagination state (pageIndex and pageSize) */ pagination: PaginationState; /** Callback fired when pagination changes */ onPaginationChange: OnChangeFn<PaginationState>; /** Current sorting state */ sorting?: SortingState; /** Callback fired when sorting changes */ onSortingChange?: OnChangeFn<SortingState>; /** Total number of rows available (for server-side pagination). If not provided, uses data.length */ rowCount?: number; /** Whether data is currently loading */ loading?: boolean; /** Message to display when there is no data / emptyMessage?: string; /** Available page size options for the pagination dropdown / pageSizeOptions?: number[]; /** Callback fired when a row is clicked */ onRowClick?: (row: TData) => void; /** Configuration for the query builder (filters) */ query?: RemoteDataTableQueryBuilderProps; }; const defaultPageSizeOptions = [10, 25, 50]; /** A table component designed for displaying remote/server-side data with built-in pagination, sorting, and filtering capabilities. This component is fully controlled - all state (pagination, sorting, filters) must be managed by the parent component. For convenience, use the `useRemoteDataTable` hook to manage this state. ```tsx const tableState = useRemoteDataTable({ initialPagination: { pageSize: 25 } }); <RemoteDataTable data={items} columns={columns} {...tableState} query={{ fields: queryFields, filters: tableState.filters, onFiltersChange: tableState.onFiltersChange }} /> ```
- [Components/Tables/RemoteDataTable - With Query Builder](./?path=/story/components-tables-remotedatatable--with-query-builder) {id:components-tables-remotedatatable--with-query-builder} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/components-tables-remotedatatable--docs)

### Generators

#### Generators/ModelForm - Add Form
- ModelForm component is a generic form component for handling model-based forms. It renders form fields based on the provided model and handles form submission.
- [Generators/ModelForm - Add Form](./?path=/story/generators-modelform--add-form) {id:generators-modelform--add-form} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-modelform--docs)

#### Generators/ModelForm - Update Form
- ModelForm component is a generic form component for handling model-based forms. It renders form fields based on the provided model and handles form submission.
- [Generators/ModelForm - Update Form](./?path=/story/generators-modelform--update-form) {id:generators-modelform--update-form} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-modelform--docs)

#### Generators/ModelForm - Update Form Dense
- ModelForm component is a generic form component for handling model-based forms. It renders form fields based on the provided model and handles form submission.
- [Generators/ModelForm - Update Form Dense](./?path=/story/generators-modelform--update-form-dense) {id:generators-modelform--update-form-dense} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-modelform--docs)

#### Generators/ObjectDetails - Default
- ObjectDetails component renders detailed information about a given instance of a model. It supports rendering various types of fields including single values, groups, and arrays of groups.
- [Generators/ObjectDetails - Default](./?path=/story/generators-objectdetails--default) {id:generators-objectdetails--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-objectdetails--docs)

#### Generators/ObjectDetails - Dense
- ObjectDetails component renders detailed information about a given instance of a model. It supports rendering various types of fields including single values, groups, and arrays of groups.
- [Generators/ObjectDetails - Dense](./?path=/story/generators-objectdetails--dense) {id:generators-objectdetails--dense} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-objectdetails--docs)

#### Generators/TableList - Default
- TableList component renders a list about a given instances of a model.
- [Generators/TableList - Default](./?path=/story/generators-tablelist--default) {id:generators-tablelist--default} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-tablelist--docs)

#### Generators/TableList - Loading
- TableList component renders a list about a given instances of a model.
- [Generators/TableList - Loading](./?path=/story/generators-tablelist--loading) {id:generators-tablelist--loading} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-tablelist--docs)

#### Generators/TableList - With Options
- TableList component renders a list about a given instances of a model.
- [Generators/TableList - With Options](./?path=/story/generators-tablelist--with-options) {id:generators-tablelist--with-options} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-tablelist--docs)

#### Generators/TableList - Without Search
- TableList component renders a list about a given instances of a model.
- [Generators/TableList - Without Search](./?path=/story/generators-tablelist--wihtout-search) {id:generators-tablelist--wihtout-search} [story] [Docs](./?path=/docs/generators-tablelist--docs)
